entries.name: UpgradeExecutor
entries.description: Central contract defining the access control permissions for upgrading the system contract implementations.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: Pause and unpause and set important roles and parameters in the system contracts: Can delegate Sequencer management to a BatchPosterManager address, manage data availability and DACs, set the Sequencer-only window, introduce an allowList to the bridge and whitelist Inboxes/Outboxes.

entries.name: Inbox
entries.description: Facilitates sending L1 to L2 messages like depositing ETH, but does not escrow funds.

entries.name: OneStepProverHostIo
entries.description: One of the modular contracts used for the last step of a fraud proof, which is simulated inside a WASM virtual machine.

receivedPermissions.description: Can propose new state roots (called nodes) and challenge state roots on the host chain.

entries.name: EdgeChallengeManager
entries.description: Contract that implements the main challenge protocol logic of the fraud proof system.

entries.name: OneStepProverMemory
entries.description: One of the modular contracts used for the last step of a fraud proof, which is simulated inside a WASM virtual machine.

entries.name: OneStepProofEntry
entries.description: One of the modular contracts used for the last step of a fraud proof, which is simulated inside a WASM virtual machine.

entries.name: OneStepProver0
entries.description: One of the modular contracts used for the last step of a fraud proof, which is simulated inside a WASM virtual machine.

entries.name: RollupEventInbox
entries.description: Helper contract sending configuration data over the bridge during the systems initialization.

receivedPermissions.description: Can submit transaction batches or commitments to the SequencerInbox contract on the host chain.

entries.name: OneStepProverMath
entries.description: One of the modular contracts used for the last step of a fraud proof, which is simulated inside a WASM virtual machine.

entries.name: Bridge
entries.description: Escrow contract for the project's gas token (can be different from ETH). Keeps a list of allowed Inboxes and Outboxes for canonical bridge messaging.

allowedOutboxList.description: Can make calls as the bridge, steal all funds.

outboxHistory.description: All Outboxes that were ever set as allowed in the bridge.

allowedDelayedInboxList.description: Allowed to mint the gastoken on L2 and call `enqueueDelayedMessage()` on the bridge.

inboxHistory.description: All Inboxes that were ever set as allowed in the bridge.

receivedPermissions.description: Pause and unpause and set important roles and parameters in the system contracts: Can delegate Sequencer management to a BatchPosterManager address, manage data availability and DACs, set the Sequencer-only window, introduce an allowList to the bridge and whitelist Inboxes/Outboxes.

entries.name: Outbox
entries.description: Facilitates L2 to L1 contract calls: Messages initiated from L2 (for example withdrawal messages) eventually resolve in execution on L1.

entries.name: RollupProxy
entries.description: Central contract for the project's configuration like its execution logic hash (`wasmModuleRoot`) and addresses of the other system contracts. Entry point for Proposers creating new assertions (state commitments) and Challengers submitting fraud proofs (In the Orbit stack, these two roles are both called Validators).

minimumAssertionPeriod.description: Minimum time delta between newly created nodes (stateUpdates). This is checked on `stakeOnNewNode()`. Format is number of ETHEREUM blocks, even for L3s.

confirmPeriodBlocks.description: Challenge period. (Number of ETHEREUM blocks until a node is confirmed, even for L3s).

wasmModuleRoot.description: Root hash of the WASM module used for execution, like a fingerprint of the L2 logic. Can be associated with ArbOS versions.

arbOsFromWmRoot.description: ArbOS version derived from known wasmModuleRoots.

entries.name: SequencerInbox
entries.description: A sequencer (registered in this contract) can submit transaction batches or commitments here.

maxTimeVariation.description: Settable by the Rollup Owner. Transactions can only be force-included after the `delayBlocks` window (Sequencer-only) has passed.
